name: Losar Festival
description: Tibetan New Year celebration with traditional dances, prayers, and rituals. Monks perform sacred Cham dances wearing colorful masks.
visitorInfo: Open to public. Traditional dress encouraged.

name: Bumchu Festival
description: Sacred water vase opening ceremony. The level of water in the sacred vase is believed to predict the year's fortune for Sikkim.
visitorInfo: Limited access to main ceremony. Arrive early.

name: Saga Dawa
description: Holy month commemorating Buddha's birth, enlightenment, and parinirvana. Special prayers and rituals throughout the month.
visitorInfo: Daily prayers open to public from 6 AM.

name: Pang Lhabsol
description: Unique Sikkimese festival honoring Mount Khangchendzonga as the guardian deity of Sikkim. Features warrior dances and traditional rituals.
visitorInfo: Photography allowed in designated areas only.

name: Kagyad Dance Festival
description: Annual masked dance festival performed before Losar. Monks perform sacred dances to ward off evil spirits.
visitorInfo: Best viewing from monastery courtyard. Arrive by 9 AM.

name: Guru Rinpoche Birthday
description: Celebration of Padmasambhava's birth with special prayers, dances, and teachings.

name: Drukpa Tseshi
description: Commemorates Buddha's first sermon at Sarnath. Special prayers and teachings throughout the day.
visitorInfo: Trek starts at 7 AM from Yuksom. Moderate fitness required.

name: Meditation Retreat
description: Week-long meditation retreat for beginners and practitioners. Includes teachings, guided meditation, and silent practice.
